task.title: Pushing commits to the remote repository
task.shortdesc: If your local branch is set up to track a remote branch and the Push button in the Git Staging view toolbar displays a numbered indicator, you can publish your local commits in the remote repository.

step.cmd: To publish your changes, in the Git Staging view toolbar, click the Push to remote/branch button.

result.p: If the push was successful, the numbered indicator disappears. This means that your local branch and its remote counterpart are now both up-to-date and other contributors can now pull your updates.
